meanings.sent1: The unpopular candidate was considered unelectable by the voters.
meanings.sent2: The community knew the candidate was unelectable due to his controversial views.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat running for president is amusingly unelectable.
meanings.sent4: Her extreme policies made her unelectable in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent5: The candidate's lack of experience made him unelectable in the election.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or likely to be chosen for a position through an election.
meanings.sent1: The candidate's scandalous past made him unelectable in the eyes of the voters.
meanings.sent2: Her lack of support from the party made her unelectable for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a clown becoming the president is amusingly unelectable.
meanings.sent4: His constant flip-flopping on issues made him unelectable in the election.
meanings.sent5: The candidate's extreme views made him unelectable to the majority of voters.
